vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 937
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 937; To require States to implement drug testing programs for applicants for and recipients of assistance under the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program, which would encourage healthy, drug-free families instead of encouraging dependent behavior or on-going drug abuse.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 828
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 828; To protect the freedom of conscience for patients and the right of health care providers to serve patients without violating their moral and religious convictions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 964
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 964; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to protect small and home businesses from the burdensome and impractical requirements of the Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act of 2008.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 969
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA re: Sessions Amdt. No. 969; To provide for a point of order against any appropriations bill that fails to fully fund the construction of the Southwest border fence.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 967
vote.title: Motion To Waive CBA DeMint Amdt. No. 967; To implement President Obama's earmark reforms.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 965
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 965; To prevent taxpayer-funded bailouts for auto manufacturers.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 974
vote.title: Durbin Amdt. No. 974, As Modified; To provide that no additional estate tax relief beyone that which is already assumed in this resolution, which protects over 99.7 percent of estates from the estate tax, shall be allowed under any deficit-neutral reserve fund unless an equal amount of aggregate tax relief is also provided to Americans earning less than $100,000 per year.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 873
vote.title: Lincoln Amdt. No. 873; To create a deficit-neutral reserve fund for estate tax relief.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 798
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA re: Wicker Amdt. No. 798; To ensure that law abiding Amtrak passengers are allowed to securely transport firearms in their checked baggage.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 934
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA re: Cornyn Amdt. No. 934; To increase transparency by requiring five days of public review of legislation before passage by the Senate.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 954
vote.title: Bennett Amdt. No. 954, As Modified; To save the American taxpayer over $150,000,000,000 by adjusting spending levels beyond fiscal year 2010 to compensate for spending from the stimulus bill in the corresponding fiscal years.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 926
vote.title: Bond Amdt. No. 926; To protect workers from significant job loss by providing a point of order against climate change or similar legislation that raises Federal revenues to such an extent that it causes significant job loss in manufacturing- or coal-dependent U.S. regions such as the Midwest, Great Plains or South.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 879
vote.title: Stabenow Amdt. No. 879; To modify the authorization for climate change legislation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 811
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 811; To provide for a deficit-neutral reserve fund to establish a national usury law, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 950
vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 950; To ensure that millions of middle-income families do not face an alternative minimum tax increase in 2013 and 2014 and that the budget resolution reflects that result.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 803
vote.title: Thune Amdt. No. 803; To protect charitable giving by ensuring that organizations that provide important religious, educational, cultural, health care, and environmental services are not negatively impacted by changes to the Federal income tax deduction for charitable donations.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 953
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 953, as Modified; To add a deficit-neutral reserve fund for the 21st Century Community Learning Centers afterschool program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 931
vote.title: Landrieu Amdt. No. 931; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund for outer Continental Shelf oil and natural gas leasing revenues.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 910
vote.title: Graham Amdt. No. 910; To protect middle-income taxpayers from a national energy tax.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 787
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 787; To end $272 billion in spending on bailouts under TARP and reduce record deficits and levels of debt.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 949
vote.title: Reed Amdt. No. 949; To provide for the expenditure of the remaining Troubled Asset Relief Program funds for the benefit of consumers.

vote.question: On the Motion to Recommit
vote.title: Johanns Motion to Recommit to the Committee on the Budget; An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2010, revising the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2009, and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2011 through 2014.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 875
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 875; To require information from the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System about the use of emergency economic assistance.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 913
vote.title: Dodd Amdt. No. 913; To provide for enhanced oversight of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System concerning the use of emergency economic assistance.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 882
vote.title: McCain Amdt. No. 882, as Modified; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 805
vote.title: Ensign Amdt. No. 805; To require certain higher-income beneficiaries enrolled in the Medicare prescription drug benefit to pay higher premiums, as is currently required for physicians' services and outpatient services, and as proposed in the budget of the United States Government most recently submitted by the President.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 793
vote.title: Kyl Amdt. No. 793; To protect all patients by prohibiting the use of data obtained from comparative effectiveness research to deny coverage of items or services under Federal health care programs and to ensure that comparative effectiveness research accounts for advancements in genomics and personalized medicine, the unique needs of health disparity populations, and differences in the treatment response and the treatment preferences of patients.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 735
vote.title: Johanns Amdt. No. 735; To prohibit the use of reconciliation in the Senate for climate change legislation involving a cap and trade system.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 869
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA re: Whitehouse Amdt. No. 869; Relative to a deficit-neutral reserve fund to invest in clean energy and preserve the environment.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 844
vote.title: Crapo Amdt. No. 844; To protect the fiscal discipline on discretionary spending exercised by the reported budget resolution by extending the resolution's discretionary spending limits to exactly the same level as already assumed in the resolution to make sure that debt is not increased further than contemplated by this budget resolution as a result of subsequent budget resolution or appropriation bills.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 835
vote.title: Gregg Amdt. No. 835; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to address our Nations long term fiscal problems.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 806
vote.title: Cornyn Amdt. No. 806; To protect small businesses from higher taxes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 804
vote.title: Ensign Amdt. No. 804; To protect middle-income taxpayers from tax increases by providing a point of order against legislation that increase taxes on them, including taxes that arise, directly or indirectly, from Federal revenues derived from climate change or similar legislation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 772
vote.title: Sessions Amdt. No. 772, As Modified; To restore the budget discipline of the Federal Government by freezing nondefense discretionary spending for fiscal years 2010 and 2011, and limiting the growth of nondefense discretionary spending to one percent annually for fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 747
vote.title: Alexander Amdt. No. 747; To create runaway debt point of order against consideration of a budget resolution that projects the ratio of public debt to GDP for any fiscal year in excess of 90% to ensure the continued viability of US dollar and prevent doubling or tripling the debt burden on future generations.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 739
vote.title: Gregg Amdt. No. 739; To prohibit the consideration of any budget resolution, or amendment thereto, or conference report thereon, that shows an increase in the public debt, for the period of the current fiscal year through the next 10 years, equal to or greater than the debt accumulated from 1789 to January 20, 2009.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 731
vote.title: Thune Amdt. No. 731; To amend the deficit-neutral reserve fund for climate change legislation to require that such legislation does not increase electricity or gasoline prices.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 749
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 749; To require that certain legislation relating to clean energy technologies not increase electricity or gasoline prices or increase the overall burden on consumers.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 599

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 607

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 623
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 623 as Modified; To prohibit taxpayer dollars from being earmarked to 14 clients of a lobbying firm under Federal investigation for making campaign donations in exchange for political favors for the group's clients.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 610
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 610; To prohibit funding for congressional earmarks for wasteful and parochial pork projects.

vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 297; To provide the same temporary increase in the FMAP for all States and to permit States to choose the period through June 2011 for receiving the increase.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 501
vote.title: Graham Amdt. No. 501 As Modified; To limit wasteful spending, to fund a systematic program of foreclosure prevention, to be administered by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 176
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 176; To require the use of competitive procedures to award contracts, grants, and cooperative agreements funded under this Act.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 309
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 309; To ensure that taxpayer money is not lost on wasteful and non-stimulative projects.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 176
vote.title: Motion to Table Coburn Amdt. No. 176; To require the use of competitive procedures to award contracts, grants, and cooperative agreements funded under this Act.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 197
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Thune Amdt. No. 197; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 353
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Ensign Amdt. No. 353; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 189
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 189; To allow the free exercise of religion at institutions of higher education that receive funding under section 803 of division A.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 140
vote.title: Feingold Amdt. No. 140; To provide greater accountability of taxpayers' dollars by curtailing congressional earmarking and requiring disclosure of lobbying by recipients of Federal funds.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 364
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA McCain Amdt. No. 364 As Modified; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 279
vote.title: McCain Amdt. No. 279; To prohibit the applicability of Buy American requirements in the Act to the utilization of funds provided by the Act.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 242
vote.title: Motion to Waive Section 201, S. Con. Res. 21, 110th Congress, Bunning Amdt. No. 242; To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to suspend for 2009 the 1993 income tax increase on Social Security benefits, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 277
vote.title: Motion to Waive Sec. 201 of S. Con. Res. 21, 110th Congress, Re: Cornyn Amdt. No. 277; To reduce income taxes for all working taxpayers.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 262
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Inhofe Amdt. No. 262; To appropriate, with an offset, $5,232,000,000 for procurement for the Department of Defense to reconstitute military units to an acceptable readiness rating and to restock prepositioned assets and war reserve material.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 278
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: McCain Amdt. No. 278; To reimplement Gramm-Rudman-Hollings to require deficit reduction and spending cuts upon 2 consecutive quarters of positive GDP growth.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 238
vote.title: Thune Amdt. No. 238; To ensure that the $1 trillion spending bill is not used to expand the scope of the Federal Government by adding new spending programs.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 168
vote.title: Motion to Waive Sec. 201 of S. Con. Res. 21, 110th Congress, Re: DeMint Amdt. No. 168; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 179
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 179; To eliminate unnecessary spending.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 112
vote.title: Motion to Waive Sec. 201 of S. Con. Res. 21, 110th Congress Re: Boxer Amdt. No. 112; To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow the deduction for dividends received from controlled foreign corporations for an additional year, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 104
vote.title: Motion to Waive Sec. 201 of S. Con. Res. 21, 110th Congress Re: Mikulski Amdt. 104; To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an above-the-line deduction against individual income tax for interest on indebtedness and for State sales and excise taxes with respect to the purchase of certain motor vehicles.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 109
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 109; To strike the $246 million tax earmark for Hollywood production companies.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 110
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Re: Murray Amdt. No. 110 Emergency Designation; To strengthen the infrastructure investments made by the bill.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Eric H. Holder, Jr., of the District of Columbia, to be Attorney General

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 2 as Amended; Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 93
vote.title: Hutchison Amdt. No. 93; To provide assistance for States with percentages of children with no health insurance coverage above the national average.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 63
vote.title: Bingaman Amdt. No. 63 as Modified; To clarify that new paperwork and enrollment barriers are not created in the Express Lane Enrollment option and that income may be determined by Express Lane agencies based on State income tax records or returns.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 86
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 86; To ensure that American children have high-quality health coverage that fits their individual needs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 85
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 85; To provide an above-the-line Federal income tax deduction for health care costs of certain children in an amount comparable to the average federal share of the benefit provided to any non-citizen child for medical assistance or child health assistance.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 80
vote.title: Hatch Amdt. No. 80; To codify regulations specifying that an unborn child is eligible for child health assistance.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 74
vote.title: Motion to Table Bunning Amdt. No. 74 as Modified; To eliminate any exceptions to the prohibition on States receiving an enhanced Federal matching rate for providing coverage to children whose family income exceeds 300 percent of the poverty line.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 47
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 47; To ensure that children do not lose their private insurance and that uninsured children can get access to private insurance.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 77
vote.title: Murkowski Amdt. No. 77; To provide for the development of best practice recommendations and to ensure coverage of low income children.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 46
vote.title: Kyl Amdt. No. 46; To reinstate the crowd out policy agreed to in section 116 of H.R. 3963 (CHIPRA II), as agreed to and passed by the House and Senate.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 75
vote.title: Roberts Amdt. No. 75; To prohibit CHIP coverage for higher income children and to prohibit any payments to a State from its CHIP allotments for any fiscal year quarter in which the State Medicaid income eligibility level for children is greater than the income eligibility level for children under CHIP.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 67
vote.title: Motion to Table Cornyn Amdt. No. 67; To ensure redistributed funds go towards coverage of low-income children or outreach and enrollment of low-income children, rather than to States that will use the funds to cover children from higher income families.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 65
vote.title: Martinez Amdt. No. 65; To restore the prohibition on funding of nongovernmental organizations that promote abortion as a method of birth control (the "Mexico City Policy").

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 40
vote.title: McConnell Amdt. No. 40; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Daniel K. Tarullo, to be a Member of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 43
vote.title: Motion to Table Demint Amdt. No. 43; To require States to impose cost-sharing for any individual enrolled in a State child health plan whose income exceeds 200 percent of the poverty line.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Timothy F. Geithner, of New York, to be Secretary of the Treasury

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 181; Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act of 2009

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 34
vote.title: Motion to Table Vitter Amdt. No. 34; To preserve open competition and Federal Government neutrality towards the labor relations of Federal Government contractors on Federal and federally funded construction projects.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 37
vote.title: Motion to Table Isakson Amdt. No. 37; To limit the application of the Act to claims resulting from discriminatory compensation decisions that are adopted on or after the date of enactment of the Act.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 31
vote.title: Motion to Table DeMint Amdt. No. 31; To preserve and protect the free choice of individual employees to form, join, or assist labor organizations, or to refrain from such activities.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 28
vote.title: Motion to Table Enzi Amdt. No. 28; To clarify standing.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 27
vote.title: Motion to Table Specter Amdt. No. 27; To limit the application of the bill to discriminatory compensation decisions.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 26
vote.title: Motion to Table Specter Amdt. No. 26; To provide a rule of construction.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 25
vote.title: Hutchison Amendment No. 25; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Nomination
vote.title: Confirmation Hillary Rodham Clinton, of New York, to be Secretary of State

vote.question: On the Joint Resolution
vote.title: S.J.Res. 5; A joint resolution relating to the disapproval of obligations under the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to S.181; Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act of 2009

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S.22 as Amended.; Craig Thomas Snake Headwaters Legacy Act of 2008

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on S.22.; Craig Thomas Snake Headwaters Legacy Act of 2008

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to S. 22; Craig Thomas Snake Headwaters Legacy Act of 2008
